update.description:
When the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID and WS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY are set in the environment, machines are going to be launched on AWS.

Otherwise, the "fake" cloud service is used.
update.title: AWS in the loop

content.raw:
Instead of moving the code up, I added code to terminate simulations when the database save fails.

This code was needed anyways for the database writes that had to be performed after launch (save the ip and save the aws server instance).
content.html:
Instead of moving the code up, I added code to terminate simulations when the database save fails.

This code was needed anyways for the database writes that had to be performed after launch (save the ip and save the aws server instance).

content.raw: keyName should reference a key that is already uploaded in the AWS region where the simulator is launched. TBD

content.raw: just checking, is it ok to have the `keyName` here? or should they also be an environment variable?

content.raw: use camelCase to keep style consistent?
